section:
Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Class Reference Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt
A Utility class that gives all byte[], uint[] and ulong[] buffers bitpacking/serialization methods.
Collaboration diagram for Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt:

Detailed Description
A Utility class that gives all byte[], uint[] and ulong[] buffers bitpacking/serialization methods.
Definition at line 37 of file ArraySerializeExt.cs.
Member Function Documentation
Append()[1/4] AppendPhoton.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExtAppend
static void Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.Append (this byte[] buffer, ulong value, ref int bitposition, int bits)[static]
Faster Primary Write method specifically specifically for sequential writes.
Doesn't preserve existing data past the write point in exchnage for a faster write.
Parameters
buffer
value
bitposition
bits

Read()[3/7] ReadPhoton.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExtRead
static ulong Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.Read (this byte[] buffer, ref int bitposition, int bits)[static]
This is the Primary byte[].Read() method.
All other byte[].ReadXXX() methods lead here. For maximum performance use this for all Read() calls and cast accordingly.
Parameters
buffer
The array we are deserializing from.
bitposition
The position in the array (in bits) where we will begin reading.
bits
The number of bits to read.
Returns
UInt64 read value. Cast this to the intended type.

ReadFloat() ReadFloatPhoton.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExtReadFloat
static float Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.ReadFloat (this byte[] buffer, ref int bitposition)[static]
Reads a uint32 from the buffer, and converts that back to a float with a ByteConverter cast.
If performance is a concern, you can call the primary (ByteConverter)byte[].Read())
Parameters
buffer
The array we are reading from.
bitposition
The bit position in the array we start the read at. Will be incremented by 32 bits.
Definition at line 257 of file ArraySerializeExt.cs. Here is the call graph for this function:
ReadOutSafe()[1/4] ReadOutSafePhoton.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExtReadOutSafe
static void Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.ReadOutSafe (this byte[] source, int srcStartPos, byte[] target, ref int bitposition, int bits)[static]
Read the contents of one array buffer to another.
This safe version doesn't use Unsafe, and may be up to 3x slower than ReadArrayOutUnsafe().
Parameters
source
Source array to copy from.
srcStartPos
Bit position in source to start reading frome.
target
Target array
bitposition
Current write position for target. Will start writing at this bitposition. Value gets incremented.
bits
Number of bits to readout. Typically the current write position of the source buffer.

static void Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.Write (this byte[] buffer, ulong value, ref int bitposition, int bits)[static]
This is the primary byte[].Write() method.
All other byte[].Write methods lead to this one, so when performance matters, cast using (ByteConverter)value and use this method.
Parameters
buffer
value
bitposition
bits
Returns

WriteFloat() WriteFloatPhoton.Compression.ArraySerializeExt Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExtWriteFloat
static void Photon.Compression.ArraySerializeExt.WriteFloat (this byte[] buffer, float value, ref int bitposition)[static]
Converts a float to a 32bit uint with ByteConverter, then writes those 32 bits to the buffer.
Parameters
buffer
The array we are reading from.
value
The float value to write.
bitposition
The bit position in the array we start the read at. Will be incremented by 32 bits.
